It seems that problem has occured in parsing encrypted private key.
Is it reproducible?  If so, can you provide me a 'dummy' private key?
Sorry - not sure what you mean.

|Sorry - not sure what you mean. 

Ok, so another question.
How can I reproduce that problem on my environment?
Can you give me a hint?

>Can you give me a hint?
It happened when I connected to CVS using the workspace I use on a daily basis.
It worked before and the next time it also worked again like a charm.

|It happened when I connected to CVS using the workspace I use on a daily 
basis.
  |It worked before and the next time it also worked again like a charm.

I guess you are using the public key authentication and
,at that time you gave 'incorrect' passphrase.
Is there such a possibility?
If so, I may have found a problem.
Yes I tend to enter wrong passphrase from time to time since it is quite long.

|Yes I tend to enter wrong passphrase from time to time since it is quite long.

Thank you for prompt reply.
I found a problem and it will be fixed in next jsch release.

I guess you can easily reproduce that problem by givinig 'incorrect' passphrase.

jsch-0.1.13 and some modifications for #52465
